content: Hi everyone, little new to this space, apologies if not right venue. I'm helping build out a FHIR API that can serve the health-cards-issue operation (POST /Patient/:id/$health-cards-issue). We're leveraging AWS' FHIR Works solution and I know we need to extend the base setup to include the health-cards-issue Operation. Anyone have any luck doing this? Or can point me in the right direction to start?
@Angus McAllister I wonder if you might have insight on this.
Thx @Josh Mandel for tagging me. @Pradeep Gopal, I'll DM you.
Anything you can share back here would be great! I also would like to know the answer to these questions :-)
Thanks for connecting us Josh. And absolutely, can post our findings here after.
@Angus McAllister please share the insights specific to AWS FHIR works here for the community's benefit. Thanks.

@Pradeep Gopal How has been your experience with AWS FHIR Works (AFW), we just stumbled upon it and since we are pretty unhappy with HAPI JPA performance, database bloats, costs etc we are looking into alternatives. So could you share your experience with AFW and or other FHIR server implementations

@dsh So, I haven't had much experience with FHIR in the past, so I don't have much to compare to. But so far my team really like AWS' FHIR Works. It's slowly providing most of what we need (allowing for SMART Health cards). The Support engineers are pretty active and helpful as well. One thing we're still trying to work out is auth. We're currently using the default cognito, but do want to move into a SMART auth server approach
Question was then asked in the following thread, with developer advice provided: https://github.com/awslabs/fhir-works-on-aws-authz-smart/issues/29.
